verses.text: A long time after the LORD had given Israel rest from all their enemies around them, Joshua had grown old and was advanced in age.
verses.comment: Phrase 'advanced in age' is a direct rendering of the Hebrew for 'very old'.

verses.text: Joshua called for all Israel—for their elders, heads, judges, and officers—and said to them, 'I am old and advanced in age.'
verses.comment: This verse lists the leadership categories as given in the original text.

verses.text: You have seen all that the LORD your God has done to all these nations on your behalf, for the LORD your God is the one who has fought for you.
verses.comment: Direct statement; uses 'on your behalf' for Hebrew 'before your eyes'.

verses.text: Look, I have allotted to you by lot these remaining nations, as an inheritance for your tribes. They remain among all the nations I have cut off, from the Jordan to the Great Sea toward the west.
verses.comment: 'Great Sea' refers to the Mediterranean, as in the original text.

verses.text: The LORD your God will drive them out from before you and push them away from you. You will possess their land as the LORD your God promised you.
verses.comment: 'Drive out' matches the strong eviction language of Hebrew.

verses.text: So be very strong to keep and to do all that is written in the Book of the Law of Moses, so that you do not turn aside from it to the right or to the left;
verses.comment: Phrase 'not turn aside to the right or to the left' maintained from Hebrew idiom.

verses.text: so that you do not mix with these nations who remain among you, nor mention the names of their gods, nor make anyone swear by them, nor serve them, nor bow down to them;
verses.comment: 'Mix with these nations,' reflects 'go in among,' clarifying separation from idolatry.

verses.text: But you must cling to the LORD your God, just as you have done up to this day.
verses.comment: 'Cling' is literal; same root as 'cleave' or 'hold fast.'

verses.text: For the LORD has driven out great and strong nations from before you, and as for you, no one has stood against you to this day.
verses.comment: Phrase 'stood against you' directly reflects Hebrew idiom for resistance.

verses.text: One of you puts a thousand to flight, because it is the LORD your God who fights for you, just as He promised you.
verses.comment: Uses 'puts to flight,' a standard translation for the Hebrew idiom.

verses.text: So watch yourselves carefully to love the LORD your God.
verses.comment: 'Watch yourselves carefully' reflects literal Hebrew phrase for guarding your life.

verses.text: For if you turn away and cling to the remainder of these nations that stay among you and intermarry with them, associating yourselves with them and they with you,
verses.comment: 'Intermarry' and 'associate' render the two Hebrew verbs for join and mix.

verses.text: know for certain that the LORD your God will no longer drive out these nations from before you. They will be snares and traps to you, whips on your sides, and thorns in your eyes, until you perish from this good land that the LORD your God has given you.
verses.comment: Kept vivid imagery ('thorns in your eyes, snares, whips') using literal Hebrew.

verses.text: Now look, today I am going the way of all the earth. You know in your hearts and souls that not one word of all the good things the LORD your God promised concerning you has failed; all have come to pass, not one of them has failed.
verses.comment: 'The way of all the earth' is an idiom meaning death, kept literal.

verses.text: But just as all the good things that the LORD your God has promised you have come to you, so will the LORD bring upon you all the evil things, until He has destroyed you from this good land that the LORD your God has given you.
verses.comment: Repeats 'the LORD your God has given you' to reflect original parallel structure.

verses.text: If you transgress the covenant of the LORD your God, which He commanded you, and go and serve other gods and bow down to them, then the anger of the LORD will burn against you, and you will quickly perish from the good land He has given you.
verses.comment: 'Transgress the covenant' is a direct phrase from the original; consequences stated plainly.
